ai.summary: Millennium Way Circular Walk 14 is a short, easy 3.3 km loop in the United Kingdom. Suitable for beginners and casual walkers, it combines a mix of urban and rural scenery along well-maintained paths. The route is the 14th in the Millennium Way circular series and offers a relaxed, accessible stroll with light elevation and frequent points of interest.
ai.terrain_summary: The trail primarily uses well-maintained footpaths, pavements, and minor rural roads. Expect a mostly flat to gently undulating route with occasional grassy or gravel surface sections; some parts may be uneven or muddy after rain.
ai.safety_notes: Carry water and a light snack. Wear sturdy footwear with good grip. Check weather and daylight hours; UK conditions can change quickly. Stay on marked paths, mind traffic on road sections, and supervise children. Have a charged phone and a map or offline GPS in areas with poor signal.
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) for milder weather and longer daylight; the route can be done in winter with extra layers and careful footing.

seo.meta_description: Discover Millennium Way Circular Walk 14, an easy 3.3 km loop in the UK. Flat to gentle terrain, beginner-friendly, with tips on safety and gear.
